Our first official week is coming to a close, but before we go for the weekend we wanted to share some pictures and some well deserved gratitude.

First, thank you to all the transportation staff, teachers, cafeteria staff, teacher assistants, teacher aides, clerical staff, maintenance and janitorial staff, IT staff, counselors, administration and everyone else who has made this week such a success. It truly takes a team!

Secondly, thank you to the parents whom have shown us support and grace as we maneuver through this new experience. Your kind words are truly appreciated. We are working hard to fix any "first week hiccups" but please know that everyone is devoted to your child's education here in Marathon.

Last but not least, thank you to the kids, your excitement to be back and your appreciation is what makes all of this worth it!

So yes, we are washing, we are masking, we are 6ft apart but we are also learning, laughing, playing, and just being kids. We are #mcsstrong!

Appleby Yearbook Update:

Dear Parents,

I know how important yearbooks are and wanted to give you an update from Lifetouch, our picture and yearbook provider:

“Lifetouch, like many organizations, has been affected by COVID-19, which has significantly impacted our ability to produce yearbooks. I want to sincerely apologize and fully acknowledge that this is not what you as our customers expect, nor deserve, from Lifetouch. Our primary yearbook production facilities are located in some of the states that are being hardest hit by the pandemic. It is critical to prioritize the safety of our employees and take all necessary precautions. I realize this has created a lot of frustration, but please know that teams are doing everything possible to get the finished product in your hands.”

My apologies for the delay and hope that the information provided by Lifetouch is received with understanding and patience. We will provide more information about this situation as it is received.

Jonathan Hillis

Dear Marathon Alumni,

The Marathon Alumni Association Board of Directors, after much discussion, thought and realization, has decided to cancel the Alumni Banquet because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

This decision was not arrived at easily. Considering the safety of our Alumni, the Seniors and their parents is utmost, and based on the uncertainty and fluidity of the COVID-19 restrictions, plus the unknown as to when we can return to "normal," the cancellation was difficult if not prudent.

We are working on contingency plans for the seniors and their parents, but no final decisions have been made. Please be aware that when things become clearer, we will have more information available.

Please stay safe!

Kevin Arnold

President, Marathon Alumni Association

The NYS Department of Agriculture and Markets recently awarded $350,000 to 91 schools throughout New York State, and Marathon made the list!

Per the announcement, "Funding was awarded for agricultural education programs’ curriculum development, teacher professional development, program development, resource acquisition, and program coordination."

Some of the funded projects across the State include:

- Updating learning labs, including new benches in the school greenhouse

- Adding onsite work-based learning opportunities, such as apiaries and small animal housing

- Purchasing advanced scientific equipment such as LabQuests, sensors, and simulated suture kits

- Improving the leadership and career readiness of students and teachers through conferences and professional development

Click on the link below to read the full announcement!
